title: Naughty forty-year-olds are turning to sex toys and al fresco romps to spice up their sex lives
text:
Do you like in an erogenous zone? 
Our survey found middle-aged sex varied widely depending on where people were from. 
It was at its best in Scotland and Northern Ireland, with 21% and 23% respectively saying they enjoy sex “much more” than they did in their younger years. 
In England, Northerners have the edge on Southerners, with 20% admitting to having a blast compared with 18%. 
But London is definitely the middle-aged swinging capital, with 6% trying it for the first time post-40 there. 
Wales come top for one-night stands, with 23% admitting to trying one. First STIs are experienced the most there too... 
And again, the playful Welsh dominate when it comes to fantasising, at 28%. They are more likely to use a sex toy as well – as 33% admit trying it. 
But role play is one for the English,15% of whom have tried it as a first in middle-age – rising to 22% in London. And the Northern Irish lead in sexting outside your relationship post-40, with 11% fessing up. With the kids gone and HRT, the cougar in a woman is growling 
By KATHY LETTE, best-selling author 
I do all my research in an in-depth, scientific fashion – ie over cocktails with girlfriends. And what I’ve gleaned is that women definitely hit their sexual peak in their 50s and 60s. 
Why? Well, truly mind-blowing sex is only really possible when a woman learns to let go, when she’s not preoccupied with holding in her stomach or worried if her breasts are big enough or bottom small enough. 
And by middle age most women are comfortable in their skin. We’re no longer spending a fortune on cellulite “miracle” creams (so-called because it’s a miracle anyone would be stupid enough to fork out a hundred quid for it) because we’ve finally worked out that looking good naked is a case of mind over matter – if you don’t mind, it don’t matter. 
Also, once you hit your 50s, the kids have left home. A woman’s sex life definitely deteriorates with the onset of motherhood. Despite the beanbags and the water births and the plinky- plonky harp music, giving birth still boils down to a doctor putting a knee on your chest, spreading your legs and diving in with a pair of barbecue tongs. 
Which is why a new mum’s favourite position is the “doggy position” – where he begs and she rolls over and plays dead. 
And even when a mum’s sex drive gets back in gear, kids are a contraceptive. Every time you want to make love the toddler toddles in or the teenager bursts through the door to nab the car keys. (My top sex tip for parents – Vaseline... on the doorknobs. Sounds painful but they can’t get in!) 
Parents can also forget eroticism. The only times mums “talk dirty” is when ordering our kids to wash their hands before dinner and pointing out their rooms are a pigsty. 
And as for Fifty Shades-type S&M? Well, sure, mums get beaten all the time – mostly at Monopoly. 
But with an empty nest and HRT, middle-aged women are ready for their last hormonal hoorah. The stereotypical scenario is that older men chase younger women. But, in reality, all my cougar girlfriends are stalking the urban jungle on the hunt for toyboys. 
And this dynamic makes sense. Think about it. Males hit their sexual prime in their late teens and women in their 50s. 
Do the maths – 19 goes into 60 a hell of a lot more than 60 goes into 19. 
Happy hunting, girls! 
- Kathy Lette has written 13 best-selling novels about the sex war. The latest is Best Laid Plans. Like us on Facebook
